[[File:Giorgio Rossi Cairo Value Partners.jpg|thumb|Giorgio Rossi Cairo]] '''Giorgio Rossi Cairo''' ([[Varese]], 15 July 1947) is an Italian entrepreneur. He is managing director of [[Value Partners (management consulting)|Value Partners]], the management consulting multinational he founded in 1993.
== Biography == Degree in Aerospace Engineering from the [[Milan_Polytechnic|Polytechnic University of Milan]] and graduate of the Executive Program in Finance at INSEAD, [[Fontainebleau]].
From 1972 to 1973 he was a CNR researcher at the Polytechnic University of Milan. He subsequently worked until 1978 as Executive Vice President of the Transportation Planning Division at Polytecna Harris, an Italian-American engineering company.[1]
From 1979 to 1992, he was a director of [[McKinsey & Company]] and a member of the Principal Candidate Evaluation Committee.[2]
In 1993, he founded [http://www.valuepartners.com/en/ Value Partners], a global management consulting firm with 6 offices in 5 countries: Milan (headquarters), London, Rio de Janeiro, Buenos Aires, Shanghai and Hong Kong.
In 2000, he set up Value Team, a system integrator specializing in business-critical IT services. In April 2011, Value Team was sold to NTT DATA.
In 2016, he founded Exage, a company with focus on digital Innovation. Exage helps companies to navigate through the challenges of digital transformation and to manage issues such as cyber security, big data, digital strategy, service design, UX/UI, web and mobile development, communication and social media.
Through Forever, his family’s investment company, Giorgio Rossi Cairo is a partner in four other companies: [http://www.maus.it/en/default.asp Maus], a producer of automatic fettling, grinding and vertical turning machines; [http://www.ecornaturasi.it/en/ EcorNaturaSì], a leading distribution and retail company of organic food, [https://www.cmsantagostino.it/en Centro Medico Sant’Agostino], a health care services provider, and [http://www.corriere.it/economia/16_ottobre_16/italian-creation-group-acquisisce-fontana-arte-toscoquattro-83966f70-938f-11e6-b6f7-636834b27d39.shtml ItalianCreationGroup], an industrial holding that specializes in home design and luxury Italian lifestyle.
== External links == *[http://www.valuepartners.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/value-partners-171211-sfida-digitale-GRC-LEconomia-Corriere-della-Sera.pdf 18 buoni motivi per non perdere in treno digitale] L’Economia del Corriere della Sera, Federico De Rosa, 11 December 2017. *[http://www.gamberorosso.it/it/vini/1046224-l-arte-contemporanea-nelle-cantine-in-italia-un-rapporto-che-continua L’arte contemporanea nelle cantine italiane. Un rapporto che continua] Gambero Rosso, Loredana Sottile, 3 November 2017. *[http://www.fondazionelaraia.it/files/diconodinoi_file/2017/1705025_LaStampa.pdf Gavi, l'azienda agricola che fa arte tra i vigneti], La Stampa, Daniele Prato, 25 May 2017. * [http://www.ilsole24ore.com/art/notizie/2017-05-03/vino-biodinamico-l-80percento-va-all-estero-162934.shtml?uuid=AEfoGeBB&fromSearch Vino biodinamico La Raia, l'80% va all'estero - Il Sole 24 Ore] Giorgio dell'Orefice, 3 May 2017. * [http://www.valuepartners.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/value-partners-161121-Exage-GRC-Corriere-Economia.pdf Industria 4.0 "Vi aiutiamo a fare la rivoluzione" - Corriere Economia] Greta Sclaunich, 21 November 2016. * [http://www.la-raia.it/news/parola-produttori Ecco cosa chiederei a Renzi] Il Sole 24Ore, 18 March 2015. * [http://www.valuepartners.com/downloads/PDF_Comunicati/value-partners-150307-grc_su_fibra-milanofinanza.pdf Fibra? Allacciatela come Google - MF] Gabriele Capolino, 7 March 2015. *[http://emanuelescarci.blog.ilsole24ore.com/2014/01/rossi-cairo-e-rosso-nel-capitale-di-ecornaturas%C3%AC.html Rossi Cairo e Rosso nel capitale di EcorNaturaSì], Il Sole 24Ore, Emanuele Scarci, 14 January 2014. * [http://www.valuepartners.com/downloads/PDF_Comunicati/value-partners-131118-interview_to_giorgio_rossi_cairo-international_business_daily(1).pdf China doesn’t understand much about Italy yet], International Business Daily, 13 November 2013. * [http://www.valuepartners.com/downloads/PDF_Comunicati/value-partners-130713-terzisti_grc-milanofinanza.pdf Un popolo di terzisti], Milano Finanza, Gabriele Capolino, 13 July 2013. * [http://www.valuepartners.com/downloads/PDF_Comunicati/value-partners-111205-concentrations-and-quality-low-costs-giorgio-rossi-cairo-correconomia(3).pdf Concentrations and quality low-costs: the most effective recipe for Italy to face current economic crisis], Corriere della Sera, Giorgio Rossi Cairo, 5 December 2011. *[http://www.valuepartners.com/downloads/PDF_Comunicati/value_partners__110618_the_brain_is_not_to_be_delocalized_giorgio_rossi_cairo_eng_milanofinanza.pdf The brain is not to be delocalized], MF, Gabriele Capolino, 18 June 2011. * [http://www.iese.edu/Aplicaciones/News/view.asp?id=2900&k=solutions_brain_drain_iese_alumni_event_milan_led_iese_prof_alberto_ribera Solutions for Brain Drain]. IESE Alumni Event in Milan led by IESE Prof. Alberto Ribera, Milano, Hotel Principe di Savoia, 19 maggio 2011. Giorgio Rossi Cairo takes part to the round table devoted to brain drain and Italian laws preventing it. * [http://www.valuepartners.com/downloads/PDF_Comunicati/Media%20e%20Eventi/2009/value-partners-rep_090720_interview_with_Giorgio_Rossi_Cairo_business_watch_magazine.pdf Multi 3G technology will be unified in the end], Business Watch Magazine, Zhou Yebin, 20 July 2009. *[http://www.unimib.it/upload/gestioneFiles/Symphonya/f2007issue1/rossicairoeng12007.pdf Trends in Strategic Consulting in the Face of Globalization], Università degli Studi Milano Bicocca, Symphonya. Emerging Issues in Management, 2007.

{{Infobox person | name = Giovanni Ferrero | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1964|9|21|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Farigliano]], Italy | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | residence = | nationality = Italian | education = [[European Schools]] | occupation = Businessman | salary = | title = CEO, [[Ferrero SpA]] | term = | predecessor = | successor = | boards = | spouse = Paola Rossi | children = 2 | parents = [[Michele Ferrero]]
[[Maria Franca Fissolo]] | website = | alma mater = [[Lebanon Valley College]] | known for = | networth = US$21.9 billion (June 2018){{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/mobile/#/person/giovanni-ferrero |title=The Bloomberg Billionaires Index is a daily ranking of the world's richest people |website=Bloomberg.com |date= |accessdate=2016-05-19}} | relations = [[Pietro Ferrero]] (grandfather)
[[Pietro Ferrero Jr.]] (brother) }} '''Giovanni Ferrero''' (born 21 September 1964) is an Italian businessman. He assumed the leadership of the confectionery company [[Ferrero SpA]] after the death of his brother [[Pietro Ferrero Jr.|Pietro Ferrero]] in 2011. He has a net worth of $21.9 billion as of June 2018, according to Bloomberg. == Early life == He was born in [[Farigliano]], Italy, the son of [[Maria Franca Fissolo]] and [[Michele Ferrero]], the owner of the multinational confectionery corporation Ferrero. In 1975, he moved to [[Brussels]], Belgium, where he studied at the [[European Schools]].{{cite web|author=|url=http://archiviostorico.corriere.it/1999/giugno/28/Riservato_Come_romanzo_ce_0_9906281238.shtml |title=Archivio Corriere della Sera |website=Archiviostorico.corriere.it |date= |accessdate=2016-05-19}} Then he moved to the US, where he studied marketing at [[Lebanon Valley College]].{{cite web|url=http://www.niaf.org/niaf_event/international-entrepreneur-giovanni-ferrero-to-be-honored-at-niaf-gala-in-washington-d-c/ |title=International Entrepreneur Giovanni Ferrero To be Honored at NIAF Gala in Washington, D.C. - The National Italian American Foundation |website=Niaf.org |date= |accessdate=2016-05-19}}{{cite web|url=http://www.parmadaily.it/238172/giovanni-ferrero-laurea-ad-honorem-alluniversita-di-parma/ |title=Giovanni Ferrero, laurea ad honorem all'Università di Parma |website=Parmadaily.it |date= |accessdate=2016-05-19}} ==Career== On completing his studies, he returned to Europe to work in the family company. In 1997 he became joint-CEO of Ferrero together with his brother Pietro. In April 2011, after the death of his brother in an accident, he became the sole CEO.{{cite web|url=http://www.corriere.it/economia/11_aprile_18/ferrero-pietro-morto_243f5190-69d8-11e0-890a-a1e6d714ad88.shtml |title=Morto in Sudafrica Pietro Ferrero, ad del gruppo della Nutella - Corriere della Sera |website=Corriere.it |date= |accessdate=2016-05-19}}{{cite news|author=John Hooper |url=https://www.theguardian.com/business/2011/oct/28/ferrero-unwrapped |title=Ferrero unwrapped: Italy's secretive confectioner opens its doors | Business |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |date= |accessdate=2016-05-19}} ==Publications== * "Marketing progetto 2000. La gestione della complessità", 1990 * "Stelle di tenebra", Mondadori 1999 * "Campo Paradiso", Rizzoli 2007 * "Il canto delle farfalle", Rizzoli 2010 ==Personal life== He is married to Paola Rossi.{{cite web|url=http://www.gazzettadalba.it/2016/02/cattedrale-gremita-per-la-messa-in-memoria-di-michele-ferrero/ |title=Cattedrale gremita per la Messa in memoria di Michele Ferrero - Gazzetta d'Alba - Dal 1882 il settimanale di Alba, Langhe e Roero |website=Gazzettadalba.it |date= |accessdate=2016-05-19}} They have two sons. ==References== {{Reflist}} * Storia della Famiglia Ferrero{{cite web|url=http://www.ferrero.it/azienda/il-gruppo/una-storia-di-famiglia/una-grande-azienda |title=Storia |website=Ferrero.it |date= |accessdate=2016-05-19}} {{Portal|Biography}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ferrero, Giovanni}} [[Category:1964 births]] [[Category:Ferrero family]] [[Category:Italian billionaires]] [[Category:Italian businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from the Province of Cuneo]] {{Italy-business-bio-stub}}

{{Infobox person | name = Girma Wake | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1943|07|13}} | birth_place = [[Yeka]] district, [[Addis Ababa]] | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} (death date then birth date) --> | death_place = | nationality = | other_names = | occupation = Airline industry executive | years_active = | known_for = | notable_works = }} '''Girma Wake''' (born 13 July 1943) is an [[airline]] industry executive, and was CEO of [[Ethiopian Airlines]] from 2004 to 2011. <ref name=Nazret>{{cite web|title=How Girma Wake Changed Ethiopian Airlines |url=http://nazret.com/blog/index.php/2011/01/04/ethiopia-how-girma-wake-changed-ethiopian-airlines |work=4 January He 2011 |publisher=Nazret.com |accessdate=8 September 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131224102656/http://nazret.com/blog/index.php/2011/01/04/ethiopia-how-girma-wake-changed-ethiopian-airlines |archivedate=24 December 2013 |df= }}</ref> He served as the chairman of the Board of Directors of [[Rwandair]] until 2017.<ref>{{ cite web| title=RwandAir gets new board chair|url=http://www.newtimes.co.rw/section/read/223377| date=November 9, 2017}}</ref> ==Early life and education== Girma was born in 1943 in [[Yeka]] district, [[Addis Ababa]]. He attended the Dejazmatch Wondiyirad School and then the Kotebe Teacher's College.<ref name=Zoom>{{cite web|title=Girma Wake|url=http://www.zoominfo.com/p/Girma-Wake/325819723|publisher=Zoom Info|accessdate=8 September 2013}}</ref> He attended the [[Addis Ababa University|University College of Addis Ababa]], then the country's only higher education institution. <ref name=Zoom /> He was recruited in his second year by the airline.
==Career== Girma joined [[Ethiopian Airlines]] upon his graduation in 1965. At the time, the airline was dominated by [[Americans]], primarily from [[TWA]], which had assisted in the airline's development. Girma was one of the first Ethiopians to rise in the airline's executive hierarchy.<ref name=Zoom /> Girma stayed at the airline for nearly three decades, until debates in 1993 between the new [[Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Democratic Front]] government and the airline leadership led to several resignations, including that of Girma.
In November 2003, [[Seyoum Mesfin]], chairman of Ethiopian Airlines, and then-[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Ethiopia)|minister of foreign affairs]], offered Girma, then at [[Gulf Air]] as head of cargo operations, the position of Ethiopian Airlines' CEO. Girma, then 60, was at first reluctant to take the position, but he eventually relented with the intention for only staying in the post for five years and also serving the carrier without government interference under his leadership. <ref name=Nazret />
When Girma became CEO in February 2004, Ethiopian Airlines had only twelve [[jetliners]]. It carried 1.2 million passengers annually to 42 international and 16 domestic destinations. Girma spent most of 2004 devising a plan with the assistance from the local branch of [[Ernst and Young]]. The plan that was formulated was, Vision 2010 that was launched in 2005, however the plan was received with skepticism. Despite this, between 2005 and 2010 the airline grew at an average rate of 25% per annum. <ref name=Nazret /> The 1.2 million passengers the airline used to carry annually when Girma took office almost tripled and now stood at 3.2 million by the end of the plan. The 12 planes the airline had increased by more than three-fold to 37, and the airline's fleet was one of the youngest globally. <ref name=Nazret /> The airline went from having one codeshare agreement to becoming as a member of [[Star Alliance]], which it joined in 2011.
Under Girma, Ethiopian Airlines Girma’s created 1,500 new jobs including 250 for foreigners.The profits the airline has made have significantly raised employees’ incomes, by an average of 167 percent. Ethiopian also increased its presence in other African markets, forming a strategic partnership with the West African [[ASKY Airlines]], in which it has a 45% stake. <ref name=Nazret />
After he stepped down in 2011 mostly due to conflict with authorities on the investigation of the crashed flight [[ET 409]] which crashed into the Mediterranean Sea, shortly after it departed [[Beirut–Rafic Hariri International Airport]], killing all 90 people on board and was immediately replaced by [[Tewolde Gebremariam]], he became chairman of the United Insurance Company. In 2012, he became chairman of [[Rwandair]], the flag carrier of [[Rwanda]]. <ref name=Sports>{{cite news|author=Mamo Gebrehiwot|title=Girma Wake resigns from United Insurance Board|url=http://www.ethiosports.com/2012/10/13/girma-wake-resigns-from-united-insurance-board/|accessdate=8 September 2013|newspaper=EthioSports.com|date=13 October 2012}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Girma Wake}} [[Category:1943 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Ethiopian businesspeople]] [[Category:People from Addis Ababa]] [[Category:Businesspeople in aviation]] [[Category:Ethiopian Airlines]]

{{Infobox organization |name = Higher Education Authority |bgcolor = |fgcolor = |image = Higher_Education_Authority_of_Zambia_logo.png |image_border = |size = 200px |alt = |caption = Logo of the Higher Education Authority of Zambia |map = |msize = |malt = |mcaption = |map2 = |abbreviation = HEA |motto = |predecessor = |successor = |formation = 2015<!-- {{Start date|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> |extinction = |type = |status = |purpose = |headquarters = |location = |coords = <!-- {{Coord|LAT|LONG|type:landmark|display=inline,title}} --> |region_served = |membership = |language = |general = |leader_title = Director General |leader_name = Stephen Simukanga |leader_title2 = |leader_name2 = |leader_title3 = |leader_name3 = |leader_title4 = |leader_name4 = |key_people = |main_organ = |parent_organization = |affiliations = |budget = |num_staff = |num_volunteers = |website = {{url|http://www.hea.org.zm}} |remarks = |former name = }} The Higher Education Authority (HEA) of [[Zambia]] was established under the Higher Education Act No. 4 of 2013<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.parliament.gov.zm/node/3097 | title=The Higher Education Act No. 4 of 2013 | publisher=National Assembly of Zambia | date = 2013-02-13 | accessdate=2018-01-18 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170207190205/http://www.parliament.gov.zm/node/3097 | archivedate=2017-02-07 | df=}}</ref> in order to provide quality assurance, regulation of private and public higher education institutions and registration of private higher education institutions.
==History==
The authority was established in 2015.
==Governance==
The authority is made up of a board, forming three committees: * Finance and administration committee * Registration and accreditation committee * Standards/quality assurance committee
==References== {{reflist|2}}
[[Category:Educational organisations based in Zambia]] [[Category:Educational administration]] [[Category:Higher education authorities]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2014}} {{Infobox person | name = Hugo Barra | image = Hugo Barra 001.jpg | caption = Barra at [[LeWeb]] 2013 talking about [[Xiaomi]] | birth_name = Hugo Barra | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1976|10|28}} | birth_place = {{nowrap|[[Belo Horizonte]], [[Minas Gerais]], [[Brazil]]}} | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | residence = | nationality = [[Brazilian people|Brazilian]] | other_names ={{zh|c=虎哥}} ("Tiger Brother"){{cite web|title=小米虎哥：手机在线购买在新兴市场日益流行|url=http://hk.on.cc/hk/bkn/cnt/finance/20150730/bkn-20150730225551007-0730_00842_001_cn.html|website=hk.on.cc|accessdate=26 March 2016|language=Chinese|date=30 July 2015}} | education = Colégio Pitágoras | alma_mater = [[MIT]] ([[Master of Science|MS]]) ([[Bachelor of Science|BS]])
[[Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais|UFMG]] | occupation = [[Facebook]], a vice president of [[Oculus VR]][https://www.theverge.com/2017/1/25/14395062/hugo-barra-left-xiaomi-to-run-vr-at-facebook-oculus Hugo Barra left Xiaomi to run VR at Facebook].TheVerge.2016-01-26.[2016-01-26]. | years_active = 1999–present | known_for = Vice President, Xiaomi
Vice President and product spokesperson, Google Android division | title = | boards = | spouse = | children = | relatives = | signature = | signature_size = 120px | networth = }} '''Hugo Barra''' (born 28 October 1976 in [[Belo Horizonte, Brazil]]){{cite web|url=http://revistaepoca.globo.com/vida/noticia/2011/10/o-brasileiro-que-manda-no-android.html|title=The Brazilian who runs Android|work=Época}} is a [[Brazilian people|Brazilian]] computer scientist{{citation needed|date=April 2018}}, technology executive and entrepreneur. From 2008 to 2013, he served in a number of product management roles at [[Google]] in [[London]] and [[California]], including Vice President and product spokesman of [[Google Search|Google's]] [[Android (operating system)|Android]] division.{{cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/what-the-chinese-tech-industry-is-like-2014-1|title=This Famous Google Exec Quit His Job To Work In China — And He's Been Totally Blown Away By What He Found|work=Business Insider}} He was vice president of the Chinese electronics company, [[Xiaomi]], from 2014 to 2017. He is currently{{when|date=August 2018}} Vice President of [[Virtual reality|Virtual Reality]] at [[Facebook]], which he joined shortly after his departure from Xiaomi. ==Early life and education== Barra attended primary and secondary schools at local Colégio Pitágoras in [[Belo Horizonte]], [[Brazil]], and in 1995 enrolled at the [[Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais|Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (UFMG)]], majoring in [[Electrical Engineering]]. In 1996, Barra transferred to the [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology| Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)]], graduating with a bachelor's degree in management science and masters in electrical engineering and computer science. He was class president of the class of 2000 and student keynote speaker at MIT commencement 2000.{{cite web|url=http://newsoffice.mit.edu/2000/commence-0517|title=Students and speakers gear up for Commencement 2000|work=MIT News}} ==Career== ===Google=== [[File:A Press Conference for the Launch of Nexus 7 on September 27, 2012 in Seoul from acrofan 3.JPG|thumb|Barra with [[Eric Schmidt]] and [[Andy Rubin]] at the launch of the [[Nexus 7 (2012)|Nexus 7]]]] Barra joined American technology company [[Google]] in [[London]] in March 2008 as Group Product Manager for the [[Google Mobile Services|Google Mobile]] team.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/changingmediasummit/speaker-hugo-barra|title=Hugo Barra|work=The Guardian}} In 2010 Barra joined the [[Android (operating system)|Android]] team.{{cite web|url=https://www.google.com/events/thinkmobile2011/bios.html |title=Speaker Bios |work=Google |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130727231423/http://www.google.com/events/thinkmobile2011/bios.html |archivedate=27 July 2013 }} From 2010 to 2013, Barra’s role expanded to include product spokesperson for the [[Android (operating system)|Android]] team, speaking at both press conferences and [[Google I/O]], [[Google|Google’s]] annual developer-focused conference. Barra’s product involvement included the entire [[Android (operating system)|Android]] ecosystem of software and hardware, including [[Honeycomb (operating system)|Honeycomb]], [[Ice Cream Sandwich (operating system)|Ice Cream Sandwich]], [[Jelly Bean (operating system)|Jelly Bean]] and [[KitKat (operating system)|KitKat]] [[operating system]] launches, the [[Nexus 4]] and [[Nexus 5]] smartphones, the [[Google Nexus|Nexus 7]]{{cite web|url=http://techland.time.com/2013/07/24/google-unveils-a-new-nicer-pricier-nexus-7-tablet/|title=Google Unveils a New, Nicer, Pricier Nexus 7 Tablet|work=Time}} and [[Google Nexus|Nexus 10]] tablets,{{cite web|url=http://www.androidauthority.com/hugo-barra-android-tablet-htc-one-250126/|title=Hugo Barra: where are the Android tablets of HTC One-like quality?|work=Android Authority}} and other related products such as [[Google Now]],{{cite web|url=https://www.wired.com/2012/07/google-android-hugo-barra-interview/|title=Android Director: ‘We Have the Most Accurate, Conversational, Synthesized Voice in the World’|work=Wired}} selected in 2013 as [[Popular Science (magazine)|Popular Science’s]] Innovation of the Year,{{cite web|url=http://www.popsci.com/bown/2012/product/google-now|title=Innovation Of The Year: Google Now|work=Popular Science}} and [[Google Voice Search]], [[Google|Google’s]] speech recognition service. He was promoted to Vice President in 2012. ===Xiaomi=== In September 2013, Barra left [[Google]] for Chinese electronics company [[Xiaomi]], serving as Vice President of International.{{cite web|url=http://allthingsd.com/20130912/exclusive-hugo-barra-talks-about-his-future-at-xiaomi-and-why-he-left-google/|title=Exclusive: Hugo Barra Talks About His Future at Xiaomi and Why He Really Left Google|work=All Things D}} The move was considered a ‘significant hire’ for Xiaomi, one of the fastest growing manufacturers in China, enhancing international legitimacy to the company by adding a key former Google [[Android (operating system)|Android]] executive to its senior management.{{cite web|url=https://thenextweb.com/asia/2013/08/29/xiaomi-reportedly-nabs-google-vp-hugo-barra/|title=Xiaomi confirms it has hired Google’s Hugo Barra, who will take up VP Global role from October|work=The Next Web}} In December 2013, Barra spoke at [[LeWeb]] tech conference in [[Paris, France]] about his impressions of the [[Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference|Chinese]] economy and the opportunity it represented for tech companies such as [[Xiaomi]], citing China's 600 million internet users, high market caps of recent Chinese IPOs, the massive scale of the top Chinese apps' monthly active users, and the size of companies such as [[Alibaba Group|Alibaba's]] [[Taobao]], a shopping site more than double the size of [[eBay]] and [[Amazon.com|Amazon]] combined.{{cite web|url=http://qz.com/156977/everything-you-need-to-know-about-chinese-tech-in-one-30-minute-video/|title=Everything you need to know about Chinese tech in one 30-minute video|work=Quartz.com}} The talk was widely cited throughout the industry. In February 2014, Barra announced the launch of the new [[Xiaomi Mi1|Redmi]] and [[Xiaomi Mi3|Mi3]] smartphones in [[Singapore]],{{cite web|url=https://thenextweb.com/asia/2014/02/19/can-chinas-coolest-phone-maker-take-xiaomi-mania-international-we-ask-vp-hugo-barra/|title=Can China’s coolest phone maker take Xiaomi-mania international? We ask VP Hugo Barra|work=The Next Web}} then in [[India]]. Global expansion outside of China into surrounding emerging markets is a key initiative for [[Xiaomi]], given the company’s business model to release high performance smartphone products at an affordable consumer price, generating revenue not only from the hardware itself, but the software and internet services provided to the consumer.{{cite web|url=https://thenextweb.com/asia/2013/09/06/heres-why-you-should-care-about-rising-chinese-smartphone-firm-xiaomi/|title=Here’s why you should care about rising Chinese smartphone firm Xiaomi|work=The Next Web}} According to [[Xiaomi]] co-founder and president [[Lei Jun]], it is "entirely Barra’s job to figure out which region that we should enter next and how."{{cite web|url=https://thenextweb.com/asia/2013/09/09/xiaomi-co-founder-on-why-ex-google-exec-barra-and-its-own-firmware-are-key-to-international-success/|title=Xiaomi co-founder on why ex-Google exec Barra and its own firmware are key to international success|work=The Next Web}} Barra has stated intentions to expand next into various countries.{{cite web|url=http://www.cnet.com/news/xiaomi-world-phone-in-2-years-android-all-the-way-says-hugo-barra/|title=Xiaomi's Hugo Barra: True world phones in 2 years, Android all the way|work=CNET}} In March 2014, Barra visited [[Foxconn]], a Taiwanese manufacturing company with plants in [[Brazil]] and [[Mexico]] responsible for assembling products for various tech brands, indicating plans for [[Xiaomi]] to expand into [[Latin America]].{{cite web|url=http://www.techinasia.com/hugo-barra-teases-xiaomi-foxconn-deal-for-latin-america/|title=Hugo Barra visits Foxconn, teases Xiaomi launches across Latin America |work=techinasia.com}} In May 2014, Barra announced the launch of the [[Xiaomi#MiPad|MiPad]], a 7.9 inch tablet. "We spent four years working up to the point where we thought we had the right hardware design and software capability to build a world-class tablet," Barra said. "We think we are there, finally." Barra described the release as part of [[Xiaomi|Xiaomi's]] overall strategy to expand both its product lineup and into new international markets including [[Hong Kong]], [[Taiwan]], and [[Singapore]]. Barra also indicated eventual plans to enter the [[United States|U.S.]] market.{{cite web|url=http://thevarguy.com/business-smartphone-and-tablet-technology-solutions/051914/ex-google-whiz-barra-s-influence-showing-xiaomi|title=Ex-Google Whiz Barra’s Influence Showing at Xiaomi |work=thevarguy.com}} In January 2017, Barra announced his departure from Xiaomi. Barra explained his decision had been strongly motivated by a feeling of detachment from his family and the life he had built up in Silicon Valley. "What I've realized is that the last few years of living in such a singular environment have taken a huge toll on my life and started affecting my health. My friends, what I consider to be my home, and my life are back in Silicon Valley, which is also much closer to my family. Seeing how much I've left behind these past few years, it is clear to me that the time has come to return." {{cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2017/1/23/14355260/hugo-barra-is-leaving-xiaomi|title=Hugo Barra is leaving Xiaomi|work=theverge.com}} There are reports that quoted Barra saying that his resignation was prompted by health reasons and some analysts noted that the departure came amid Xiaomi's declining sales in China.{{Cite news|url=https://qz.com/895226/hugo-barra-is-leaving-xiaomi-to-lead-up-facebooks-nasdaq-fb-vr-efforts/|title=Hugo Barra is leaving Xiaomi to lead Facebook’s virtual reality division|last=Horwitz|first=Josh|date=26 January 2017|work=Quartz|access-date=2018-08-30|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.scmp.com/tech/article/2064612/hugo-barra-resigns-xiaomi-says-he-returning-silicon-valley|title=Hugo Barra to leave Xiaomi, return to Silicon Valley from Beijing|last=Soo|first=Zen|date=23 January 2017|work=South China Morning Post|access-date=2018-08-30|language=en}} On the other hand, global expansion has been successful. Around the time of his resignation, Xiaomi announced that it has exceeded US$1 billion in revenue from the Indian market alone. ===Facebook=== He announced in a Facebook post on 25 January 2017 that he would be joining Facebook as Vice President of virtual reality, writing:
"I’m excited to share my next adventure as I return to Silicon Valley—in a couple of months I'll be joining Facebook as VP of virtual reality (VPVR!) and lead the Oculus team. Xiaomi CEO Lei Jun always says that the highest calling of an engineer is to make technology breakthroughs quickly and readily available to the widest possible spectrum of humanity. That will be my mission at Facebook and I look forward to building the future of immersive technology with Mark Zuckerberg, Brendan Trexler Iribe, Mike Schroepfer, and the visionaries in the Oculus team."https://www.facebook.com/hbarra76/posts/10154020362016612
Based on his early pronouncements, Barra appears to be focusing on the development of standalone VR headsets as well as social VR. During an appearance at the 2018 [[Consumer Electronics Show]] (CES), he described the technology as "a product category that will help us bring the most number of people into VR and really start unlocking these opportunities for social presence."{{Cite news|url=https://www.engadget.com/2018/01/16/facebook-hugo-barra-standalone-vr/|title=Facebook's Hugo Barra says standalone headsets are key to social VR|last=Lee|first=Nicole|date=16 January 2018|work=Engadget|access-date=2018-08-30|language=en-US}} During the event, Barra announced Oculus' standalone VR headset called Oculus Go, with Xiaomi as global hardware partner. ==Honors and awards== In 2011, Barra was ranked #23 in [[Wired (magazine)|Wired Magazine’s]] Wired 100.{{cite web|url=https://www.wired.co.uk/magazine/archive/2011/06/the-wired-100/the-wired-100-29-11|title=2nd annual Wired 100|work=Wired.co.uk}} In 2013, [[Business Insider|Business Insider’s]] [[Silicon Valley]] 100 included Barra at #92.{{cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/the-silicon-valley-100-2013-2?op=1|title=The 100 Biggest Stars In Silicon Valley|work=Business Insider}} Brazil's ''[[Época (Brazilian magazine)|Época]]'' magazine ranked Barra among the most influential [[Brazilian people|Brazilians]] in both 2011{{cite web|url=http://revistaepoca.globo.com/vida/noticia/2011/12/epoca-100-os-brasileiros-mais-influentes-de-2011-trecho.html|title=Época Magazine: the 100 most influential Brazilians in 2011|work=Época Magazine}} and 2013.{{cite web|url= http://epoca.globo.com/vida/noticia/2013/12/os-b100-mais-influentes-do-brasilb-em-2013.html|title=Época Magazine: the 100 most influential Brazilians in 2013|work=Época Magazine}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Hugo Barra}} * {{Facebook|hbarra76}} {{Facebook navbox}} {{Xiaomi}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Barra, Hugo}} [[Category:1976 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Brazilian businesspeople]] [[Category:Google employees]] [[Category:Massachusetts Institute of Technology alumni]] [[Category:Brazilian computer scientists]] [[Category:Xiaomi people]]

{{notability|1=Biographies|date=February 2018}} {{Infobox person | image = Ibrahim_Mahama_-_Ghana.jpg | caption = Ibrahim Mahama | birthname = Ibrahim Mahama | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1971|01|29|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Tamale]], [[Northern Region of Ghana]] | nationality = Ghanaian | education = [[College of North West London]] | website = | occupation = Businessman | parents = [[Emmanuel Adama Mahama]]
Joyce Tamakloe | relations = [[John Dramani Mahama]] (brother) | spouse = Oona Mahama | children = 3 | net worth = 1.9 Billion Dollars }} '''Ibrahim Mahama''' (born 29 January 1971) is a [[Ghanaian]] businessman, and the founder of ''Engineers and Planners'', the largest indigenous-owned mining company in [[West Africa]], and the owner of several other businesses in Ghana.{{cite news|title=Comprehensive List of Businesses Owned by Ibrahim Mahama|url=https://yen.com.gh/92126-a-comprehensive-list-companies-owned-by-ibrahim-mahama-john-mahamas-brother.html|publisher=Yen Ghana}} He is the younger brother of [[John Dramani Mahama]], President of Ghana from 2012 to 2017. ==Early life== He was born in [[Tamale]] in the [[Northern Region of Ghana]] to [[Emmanuel Adama Mahama]], former Minister of Agriculture and the first Minister of the [[Northern Region, Ghana|Northern Region]] under the first [[President of Ghana]], [[Kwame Nkrumah|Dr. Kwame Nkrumah]].{{fact|date=September 2017}} His mother, Joyce Tamakloe came from [[Keta]] in the [[Volta Region of Ghana]].{{fact|date=September 2017}} He moved to the United Kingdom, where he studied at the [[College of North West London|College of North London]].{{fact|date=September 2017}} After college, he went on to live in London, where he worked for a property development company.{{fact|date=September 2017}} == Career == Mahama started his company Engineers & Planners in 1997 after his return from London.{{cite news|title=List of companies/businesses owned by Ibrahim Mahama|url=http://enterghana.com/list-companiesbusinesses-owned-ibrahim-mahama/|publisher=Enter Ghana}} Mahama has also invested in Asutsuare Poultry Farms, which was started in 2004 and produces 150,000 eggs and 10,000 live broilers a day.{{cite news|title=Firms Owned by Ibrahim Mahama|url=http://m.peacefmonline.com/pages/local/social/201704/312809.php|publisher=Peace FM}} Mahama is also an investor at Dzata Cement company, a fully Ghanaian-owned cement processing factory located in [[Tema, Ghana|Tema]]. Construction of the factory began in 2011, and it is set to start operations by first quarter of 2018, projected to create 1,200 direct jobs.{{cite news|title=Mahama inaugurates CIMAF cement plant|url=https://www.ghanabusinessnews.com/2016/12/01/mahama-inaugurates-cimaf-cement-plant/|publisher=Ghana Business News}} Its production capacity is projected to be 2 million tones of cement a year.{{cite news|title=New cement factory to produce 2 million tons of cement annually opened|url=http://www.myjoyonline.com/business/2016/December-7th/new-cement-factory-to-produce-1-million-tons-of-cement-annually-opened.php|publisher=Joy Online News}} He uses a Bombardier 604 luxury private jet named Dzata and was the first individual to buy one in Ghana.https://www.nytimes.com/2014/04/19/world/middleeast/paper-shows-us-flagged-plane-in-iran-has-ties-to-ghana.html == Philanthropy == Mahama has been recognized in supporting the [[Northern Ghana|Northern]] and [[Zongo community|Zongo]] communities. Ghana has about 400 Zongo communities which have been described by many as deprived communities.{{cite news|title=Ghanas Zongo Communities Waiting to be Transformed|url=http://africafeeds.com/2017/03/27/ghanas-zongo-communities-transformed/|publisher=Africa Feeds}} He has catered for many in these communities, providing for education, healthcare, employment as well as funding projects within the communities.{{fact|date=September 2017}} He is currently in the process of building a 550-bed dormitory for his former high school,{{cite news|title=Ibrahim Mahama Building 550-Bed Dormitory For TAMASCO|url=http://theheraldghana.com/ibrahim-mahama-building-550-bed-dormitory-for-tamasco/|publisher=The Herald, Ghana}} Tamale Secondary School in the [[Northern Region of Ghana]], after a fire destroyed an existing dormitory.{{cite news|title=Fire guts St Charles SHS dormitory in Tamale|url=http://www.ghananewsagency.org/social/fire-guts-st-charles-shs-dormitory-in-tamale-114627|publisher=Ghana News Agency}} ===Joyce Tamakloe Cancer Foundation=== Following the loss of his mother to cancer,{{cite news|title=Mahama’s mother to be buried today|url=http://citifmonline.com/2016/06/17/mahamas-mother-to-be-buried-today/|publisher=Citi FM}} he has championed charity causes that create awareness on different types of cancer.{{cite news|title=Tamakloe Memorial Polo scheduled for April 11|url=http://www.ghananewsagency.org/details/Sports/Tamakloe-Memorial-Polo-scheduled-for-April-11/?ci=5&ai=5560|publisher=Ghana News Agency}} He is a co-founder of the Joyce Tamakloe Cancer Foundation which has raised funds for several hospitals in Ghana as a contribution to the fight against cancer.{{cite news|title=Lack of data on breast cancer hinders awareness creation|url=https://www.ghanaweb.com/GhanaHomePage/health/Lack-of-data-on-breast-cancer-hinders-awareness-creation-Aryee-95561|publisher=Ghana Web}} The Foundation has provided free [[mammograms]] for over 1000 women across Ghana.{{fact|date=September 2017}} The foundation played a key role in ensuring [[breast cancer]] patients received treatment under the [[National Health Insurance (Ghana)|National Health Insurance]] in Ghana.{{fact|date=September 2017}} ==Personal life== He is married to Oona Mahama and they have three children.{{cite news|title=The Ordinary Side Of Ibrahim Mahama|url=http://theheraldghana.com/ordinary-side-ibrahim-mahama/|publisher=The Herald Ghana}} == References == {{DEFAULTSORT:Mahama, Ibrahim}} [[Category:Ghanaian businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1971 births]] [[Category:People from Tamale, Ghana]]

{{Infobox organisation | name = Institute of Directors | logo = IoDLogo(2015).jpg | image = Image:Building, Pall Mall - DSC04234.JPG | caption = Institute of Directors, [[Pall Mall, London]] | type = Professional organisation | founded_date = {{start date and age|1903}} | location = [[Pall Mall, London|Pall Mall]]
[[London]], [[SW postcode area|SW1]]
United Kingdom | key_people = [[Stephen Martin (businessman)|Stephen Martin]], Director General
[[Charlotte Valeur]], Chair | focus = Business | num_members = 30,500 | homepage = [http://www.iod.com iod.com] }} The '''Institute of Directors''' (IoD) is a business organisation for company directors, senior business leaders and entrepreneurs. It is the UK’s longest running organisation for professional leaders, having been founded in 1903 and incorporated by [[Royal Charter]] in 1906. The IoD, per its mission statement, stands for "[[free enterprise]], [[entrepreneurialism]], wealth creation and good [[corporate governance]]," and represents "the views of businesses and IoD members in the media and with government." {{Citation needed|date=August 2017}} The IoD is located in the [[Listed building|Grade I-listed building]] at 116 Pall Mall, formerly the [[United Service Club]]. Members of the IoD also gain access to co-working spaces around the UK, bespoke market intelligence, tailored tax and legal support, exclusive member-only events along with discounts on IoD professional development courses and events. From a high of 55,000 members in 2005, the IoD currently has just over 30,000 full members. Members of the IoD come from companies of all sizes and from all industries {{Citation needed|date=August 2017}}. Around 70% work for small and medium-sized enterprises and are typically in senior management and boardroom-level positions while 78% of [[FTSE 100 Index|FTSE 100]] companies have an IoD member on their board or in a senior management position. ==History & Royal Charter== The IoD was founded in 1903 and incorporated by royal charter in 1906.[http://www.iod.com/about-the-iod/our-royal-charter IoD Royal Charter] Retrieved 29 June 2015 The royal charter compels the IoD to: * Promote for the public benefit high levels of skill, knowledge, professional competence and integrity on the part of directors * Represent the interests of members and the business community to government and in the public arena * Encourage and foster a climate favourable to entrepreneurial activity and wealth creation * Promote the study, research and development of corporate governance ==Membership== The IoD represents individual members. Every member’s voice carries equal weight within the organisation, and members retain their membership of the IoD throughout their career. This allows the IoD free rein to speak out on behalf of the business community and discuss individual companies in public. There are currently 30,000 IoD members in the UK and Overseas, with an additional 2,500 student members. Anybody who has an interest in business, is running a business, sits on a board or runs their own company can join the IoD. In order to help address declining membership the IoD 99 was established in 2015. This initiative is aimed at members who under the age of 42, and gives a substantial discount on membership fees. Additionally IoD Advance was launched in March 2016, which gives additional benefits in return for a higher annual subscription. ==Policy== The IoD represents its members and makes the case for enterprise, entrepreneurialism and business in the public and to government. Working with various stakeholders, the IoD campaigns on issues of importance to its members and the wider business community to build an environment in the UK which supports businesses and makes is easy to start, grow and run a company. The IoD has experts on tax, infrastructure, law, Europe, corporate governance, financial services, technology, education, skills and regulation, and campaigns on all of these issues. ==Business support== The IoD’s Information and Advisory Services offer members tailored and bespoke business advice on all aspects of running a business, including unbiased and confidential legal, financial, HR, marketing, and tax support. Members of the IoD can access the support through online, telephone or face-to-face consultations, are allowed up to 25 different consultations each year. ==Training and development== The IoD is one of the country’s most prestigious training providers, and has a range of courses to suit business leaders at every stage of their career. There are role-specific training courses to equip directors with new skills to take on different roles along with the flagship Chartered Director course. [In other countries Certified Director, e.G. in [http://german-iod.org/ablauf/ Germany]] Training courses are open to both members and non-members alike, and around 5,000 people take part in an IoD course every year. The IoD networks also provide executive coaching, mentoring services and online learning zones. ==Initiatives and events== The IoD hosts hundreds of networking, policy and social events throughout the year and across the country. ===Annual Convention=== [[Image:Julia Gillard Mackworth 2015.jpg|thumb|right|[[Julia Gillard]] delivers the inaugural Mackworth Lecture at the IoD, 2015]] The Annual Convention is the flagship IoD event and a fixture of the business calendar and has historically taken place at the [[Royal Albert Hall]] each year. It draws some of the biggest business names and politicians and leaders from across the world. The convention has taken place every year since 1950. Nine different prime ministers have addressed the convention on more than eighteen occasions along with pioneers such as [[Jimmy Wales]], co-founder of [[Wikipedia]], and [[Richard Branson]], serial entrepreneur, and members of the British royal family, including the [[Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh]] and the [[Charles, Prince of Wales]]. The last Annual Convention took place in September 2016 and included former Greece finance minister [[Yanis Varoufakis]], Lord [[Norman Lamont]] of Lerwick, global economist [[Dambisa Moyo]], and [[Nicola Sturgeon]]. Owing to declining ticket and sponsorship revenues the Annual Convention took a year's break in 2017. It will take on a new look in March 2018, with the format and speaker line-up to be confirmed. ===Rhondda Lecture=== In 2015, the IoD launched the annual Rhondda Lecture, in honour of Viscountess Rhondda, the first female President of the IoD. The lecture celebrates radical thought, leadership, bold ideas and activism. [[Julia Gillard]], former Australian prime minister delivered the inaugural lecture in June 2015 at 116 Pall Mall to an audience of politicians, academics, and business leaders. [[Ruth Davidson]], leader of the Scottish Conservative party, gave the 2016 lecture and was interviewed by BBC journalist [[Laura Kuenssberg]] at 116 Pall Mall in December. ==''Director'' magazine== ''Director'' is a business and lifestyle magazine for business leaders. It is circulated bi-monthly, is free to IoD members and available to purchase through subscription. It contains interviews with business leaders and politicians, updates from the IoD, debates on topical issues, reviews and features. In April 2017 it was announced that the editorial, advertising and production functions of the magazine will be transferred over to SevenC3, a contract publisher. As a result, a number of members of staff were made redundant. This was followed by an announcement in October 2017 that the magazine would be cut back to only six issues per year. ==Structure & key people== The IoD is made up of regional divisions and branches across the UK which serve as the local point of contact for IoD members. At the national level, the IoD is governed by a board and a council, which serves as the voice of IoD members. Stephen Martin is the director general, having succeeded [[Simon Walker (business)|Simon Walker]] in October 2016. [[Barbara, Lady Judge]] became the IoD's first female chairman in May 2015. She promised to champion women and work to boost the number of women in senior executive positions across British business.[http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/946a13d4-ce5f-11e4-900c-00144feab7de.html Lady Judge stirs things up at the UK’s Institute of Directors] Retrieved 29 June 2015. In September 2018, it was announced that she would be succeeded by [[Charlotte Valeur]].{{cite web|url=http://www.theguardian.com/business/2018/sep/02/institute-of-directors-appoints-charlotte-valeur-as-chair|title=Charlotte Valeur succeeds Barbara Judge as IoD chair|first=Rupert|last=Jones|date=2 September 2018|website=the Guardian|accessdate=2 September 2018}} Internationally there are different organizations with the same target. In Germany, the [[ Deutsches Institut der Aufsichtsräte]] exists as an active non profit organization.{{cite web|url=http://german-iod.org|title=Deutsches Institut der Aufsichtsräte|author=|date=|website=Deutsches Institut der Aufsichtsräte|accessdate=2 September 2018}} ==116 Pall Mall== The IoD occupy the Grade I listed 116 Pall Mall in London, which is open to members of the IoD, and has rooms and function suites available for commercial hire. The building is owned by the [[Crown Estate]], along with the large collection of artwork that decorates the rooms. Until 1978, the building was run by the [[United Services Club]]. The building was designed by [[John Nash (architect)|John Nash]], the 19th-century architect who also designed the [[Brighton Pavilion]] and [[Marble Arch]], and constructed between 1826-28. Between 2001 and 2014, members also had use of 123 Pall Mall. This was opened as a contemporary meeting space in contrast with the more traditional 116 Pall Mall, and the interiors were created by noted designers Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway. Despite its popularity with members, the building was closed in 2014 as part of cost saving measures. 116 Pall Mall has been used as a location for many films and TV programmes, including ''[[Gandhi (film)|Gandhi]]'', ''[[Foyle's War]]'', "[[Downton Abbey]]", "[[The Ali G Show]]", "[[Parks and Recreation]]" and ''[[The Dark Knight (film)|The Dark Knight]]''. ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == *{{Official website|http://www.iod.com/ }} *[http://www.german-iod.org/ Deutsches Institut der Aufsichtsräte (German IoD)] *[http://www.director.co.uk/ Director Magazine] {{Economy of the United Kingdom}} {{Authority control}} {{Coord|51|30|26|N|0|7|54.49|W|scale:1563_region:GB|display=title}} [[Category:Corporate governance in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Business and finance professional associations]] [[Category:Business organisations based in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Grade I listed buildings in the City of Westminster]] [[Category:Grade I listed institutional headquarters]] [[Category:Institute of Directors]] [[Category:Organisations based in the City of Westminster]] [[Category:Professional associations based in the United Kingdom|Directors]]

An {{nihongo|'''intermediary corporation''' or '''intermediate corporation'''|中間法人|chūkan hōjin}} is a type of [[corporation]] which existed under [[Japanese law]] from 2002 until 2008. It was superseded by the {{nihongo|[[general corporation]]|一般社団法人|ippan shadan hōjin}} on December 1, 2008.
The intermediary corporation was designed to bridge the gap between [[Company|companies]] which work for profits and [[NGO]] and other nonprofit organizations which work for public interest. Prior to the enforcement of the law on April 1, 2002, excepting the labor union whose establishing rules were regulated under specific laws, voluntary groups such as a condo association board and hobby club were operated under informal agreements and their assets were registered with one or more of group members. However, this meant that in the absence or negligence of the goodwill by the member registering assets, group's assets could be appropriated without becoming a criminal case. While they could be reclaimed through a civil suit, this does not resolve the problem of the ownership of assets. The intermediary corporation and its associated laws were designed to protect the group's assets while limiting the potential of lawsuits against individual members.
There were two types of intermediary corporations. {{nihongo|Limited liability intermediary corporations|有限責任中間法人|yūgen sekinin chūkan hōjin}} were designed to resemble [[yugen kaisha|yūgen kaisha]] (limited companies) in formation and function, while {{nihongo|unlimited liability intermediary corporations|無限責任中間法人|mugen sekinin chūkan hōjin}} were closer to [[Gōmei gaisha | gomei kaisha]] (general partnership corporations).
==See also==
*[[Kabushiki kaisha]] *[[Godo kaisha]] *[[Mochibun kaisha]]
==External links==
* {{ja icon}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20071026040612/http://www.moj.go.jp/MINJI/MINJI41/minji41.html Ministry of Justice page on intermediary corporations]
[[Category:Japanese business law]] [[Category:Japanese business terms]] [[Category:Types of business entity]] [[Category:Corporations]]

{{refimprove|date=June 2017}} '''Jilani Humayun''' is a [[Pakistani American|Pakistani-American]] [[arms trafficking|arms trader]] who was arrested in [[New York City]] on July 19, 2007, and [[Indictment|charged]] in the [[United States District Court for the Southern District of New York]] with 11 counts of violating the [[Law of the United States|federal]] [[Arms Export Control Act]], one count of [[Conspiracy (crime)|conspiracy]] to commit [[mail fraud]] and one count of conspiracy to commit [[money laundering]].<ref name=AP>{{cite news | title = Weapons export arrest made in New York | url = https://www.usatoday.com/news/nation/2007-07-19-illegal-arms-export_N.htm?csp=34 | date = 2007-07-20 | accessdate = 2007-07-20 | publisher = [[The Associated Press]] }}</ref>
In 2003, while employed with an aviation parts employer, Humayun applied to the [[United States Department of State]] Directorate of Defense Trade Controls (DDTC) for an export license to send certain military equipment to an unidentified company in [[Malaysia]]. The application indicated that the Malaysian company was planning to forward the parts to the [[Saudi Arabia]]n [[Military of Saudi Arabia|Ministry of Defense and Aviation]]. The DDTC advised that the application was denied because the Malaysian company was an unreliable recipient of items on the [[United States Munitions List]].<ref name=PRNewswire>{{cite news | title = Long Island Man Arrested for Illegally Exporting F-5 and F-14 Fighter Jet Components | url = http://www.prnewswire.com/cgi-bin/stories.pl?ACCT=109&STORY=/www/story/07-19-2007/0004629165&EDATE= | date = 2007-07-19 | accessdate = 2007-07-20 | publisher = [[PR Newswire]]}}</ref>
In January 2004, Humayun formed his own company, '''Vash International, Inc.''', to engage in the business of export management for defense and logistic support, including [[tank]]s, [[guided missile]]s and [[multiple rocket launcher|rocket launcher]]s. Then, on 11 separate occasions between January 2004 and May 2006, Humayun, via Vash International, exported to the Malaysian company [[Northrop F-5]] and [[F-14 Tomcat]] fighter jet parts and [[CH-47 Chinook]] [[helicopter]] parts. According to [[United States Attorney]] [[Michael J. Garcia]], it is documented in public reports that the sole customer of F-14 parts is the [[Islamic Republic of Iran Air Force|Iranian Air Force]].<ref name=AP/> Neither Humayun nor Vash International applied for or received the export license required to send the parts included in the 11 shipments outside the United States.<ref name=PRNewswire/>
Humayun admitted that, at the Malaysian company's request, he undervalued the shipments on his export paperwork so that the Malaysian company could avoid paying Malaysian customs duties.<ref name=AP/> This conduct forms the basis for the mail fraud conspiracy charged. Humayun is also charged with a money laundering conspiracy relating to the Malaysian company's [[wire transfer]] payments totaling [[United States dollar|US$]]357,085 to Vash International.<ref name=PRNewswire/>
[[Magistrate#Federal judicial system|U.S. Magistrate Judge]] Ronald L. Ellis denied a request by a prosecutor to order Humayun held without [[bail]]. The judge set bond at US$500,000 and ordered Humayun detained at his home in [[Lynbrook, New York]] after Humayun's lawyer, Joyce London, described her client as a "true New Yorker" who rarely traveled and had visited Pakistan only once since coming to the United States in 1981.<ref name=AP/>
The arrest of Jilani Humayun followed action taken against [[Abdul Qadeer Khan]], another Pakistani arms trader, who was also involved in smuggling components to rogue states via Malaysia (see main article: [[Scomi Precision Engineering nuclear scandal]]).

{{Infobox Minister |name = Jorge Alberto Uribe Echavarría |image = Jorge alberto uribe.jpg |imagesize = 200px |caption = Jorge Alberto Uribe Echavarria meeting with his American counterpart Secretary of Defense [[Donald H. Rumsfeld]] in the Pentagon on September 30, 2004 |office = [[Ministry of National Defense (Colombia)|Minister of National Defense]] |term_start = 9 November 2003 |term_end = 7 July 2005 |president = [[Álvaro Uribe Vélez]] |predecessor = [[Marta Lucía Ramírez]] |successor = [[Camilo Alfonso Ospina Bernal]] |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1940|10|30}} |birth_place = [[Rionegro]], [[Antioquia Department|Antioquia]], [[Colombia]] |nationality = [[Colombian people|Colombian]] |party = |alma_mater = [[George Washington University]] |occupation = [[Businessman]] |profession = |religion = |signature = |website = }}
'''Jorge Alberto Uribe Echavarría''' (born October 30, 1940 in [[Medellín]]) is a Colombian politician and businessman. In 2003 the government of President Alvaro Uribe appointed him as Minister of Defense of Colombia.
== Biography ==
He was educated at primary and secondary schools in Colombia, with two years spent at [[Culver Military Academy]] in the [[United States]]. He completed a first degree in [[economics]] at [[George Washington University]] in the USA and did post-graduate work in [[international marketing]] at [[Besançon|Besançon University]] in [[France]].
He served as his country's [[Defence minister|minister of defense]],<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2004/11/28/international/americas/28colombia.html|title=Colombian Tells of Marxist Plot Against Bush|last=Foreno|first=Juan|date=28 November 2004|work=[[New York Times]]|accessdate=27 March 2011}}</ref> succeeding [[Marta Lucía Ramírez]], who was Colombia's first female defence minister. Prior to that appointment, he served as [[Finland]]'s [[Consulate|honorary consul]] in [[Bogotá]] for a period of ten years.
Jorge Alberto Uribe Echavarría is not related to fellow '' medellinense'' [[President of Colombia|President]] [[Álvaro Uribe Vélez]], but the two are old friends.
== Controversy ==
Jorge Alberto Uribe, rejected the accusations that the newspaper El Nuevo Herald of Miami made about the alleged affair he had with a woman arrested for drug trafficking in El Buen Pastor prison in Medellin. In a press release, the Minister confirmed that known this person for ten years and who knew of the criminal activities that took place. "In a single opportunity, in early 2003, seven months before my office as Minister of Defense, visited the Good Shepherd Jail Medellin.<ref>Ministro de Defensa niega aseveraciones del Nuevo Herald http://www.elcolombiano.com/BancoConocimiento/O/olac_el_ministro_uribe_responde_colprensa_ana_16112004/olac_el_ministro_uribe_responde_colprensa_ana_16112004.asp</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
